title: Riot you really need to focus on toxic gameplay not toxic chat.
body:
Chat doesn't ruin my fun and make me never want to play your game, I can't mute chat, or simply ignore the little chat box. What I have zero ability to control and what ruins my time in your game far more is toxic gameplay, and it is something you literally REFUSE to address year after year.

I just played a 25 minutes game where my jungler went 0/5/0 did 800 dmg to champs and refused to do anything, this player was not counter jungled in anyway shape or form. They just refused to do anything but farm jungle creeps .

The game prior to this i had a nasus top with 38 cs at 30 minutes who finished 1/10/2  and had ZERO cooldown items..

I can go on and on about this, but it is important this is in gold which is around the top 15% of your players, not the best but FAR FAR from the worst. So it is clear when you see outlyers that perform this badly that they are engaging in purposeful toxic gameplay, for a myriad of reasons i can think of. they don't type anything hostile in chat, which is all your system manages to address. They don't afk, they don't feed yet they destroy the gameplay experience 1000 times more than any idiot calling me bad or telling me to uninstall ever will.

so will you ever make even a midly legit attempt to fix the toxic gameplay the ruins ranked play 365 days a year?

There's so much wrong with your post, it's pretty funny. I clicked on the link thinking "oh, someone might actually have a legitimate complaint about the system and share similar thoughts on the subject." Nope, just a classic case of butt hurt.

Your post lacks details on why you think these players trolled you. Nasus for example. We don't know his match up, we don't know if he was getting camped hard, we don't know if he had some major lag issues, we don't know if the jungler out right refused to help him, we just don't know. So you crying about how bad he is doing isn't a legitimate reason to think he's a troll, unless you provide some other form of proof. If he was really that bad of a player report him for being unskilled and it'll drop his MMR and he'll be placed with players of similar caliber. As for Lee...He's not obligated to gank lanes, or more importantly to **WIN YOUR LANE**. The less you rely on the jungler the better, the less you heckle the jungler too will be better. A general rule I have kept is if a lane is losing by 2 or 3 more deaths, then me going  there would just be me feeding the fire unless I'm also heavily fed. That and if someone in lane is giving me attitude on how I'm jungling, I usually ignore them and help others that need it. Raging at your jungler is probably the dumbest thing you could do. It's like pissing off your friend who's giving you a ride to work. With that being said, if Lee had five deaths but didn't get counter jungled, then it seems like he actually did attempt to gank, probably early and it didn't work out, so if he's just farming creeps, he's trying to play catch up and stay relevant in the game. Your whole post on how these players are trolls lacks any sort of details as to why other than that they played poorly. My suggestion is to kick your ego and the crappy attitude you have and you'll more than likely do better. Hate players such as you that blame everyone else and think they deserve a better tier.

I do agree with the headline of the post though. Trolls have waaaaaaay too much power in the game and can single handily effect the match five minutes in, whether they feed lanes intent, afk, or whatever. It's even more asinine that players who actually do rage and fight back against these trolls are actually more likely to get banned, which is utterly stupid. Chat shouldn't even be a problem, there's a mute button in the game, use it, if they're being toxic and ruining the game for you, chances are they won't contribute anything more in chat, so just mute them and communicate with pings, it's pretty simple. Personally, being banned because of whatever is said in chat is probably the dumbest thing you could get banned for when there's literally a way to block it.
And please, don't feed me the line "But it's a game! It's meant to be fun!" So is football, soccer, golf and every other sport out there, they're all considered games and they're all, like league, competitive. I play the game to have fun and to also be competitive. You can take a guess which options I use to play competitively and which I use to be casual. Imagine your favorite football team is the Patriots, and Tom Brady is being a dick because his offensive line said his wife looked better with red hair, so he just tosses the game and refuses to throw the ball. Wouldn't you be pretty pissed off at Brady? I don't even know how or why this is a major issue in league. The games been around for years, and I would think some level of moderation would have come into play by now. Do I have any solutions? Sadly, no. It's just something I would like to see fixed by the time season six rolls around.

The issue with this is that it's much easier to identify toxic chat. It's rather straightforward to identify. In addition, whole chat logs can be retrieved so it's less prone to have things misread or taken out of context.

With "toxic play" however, It's a much more blurred line.  Having your Nasus top with only 38 CS at 30 minutes while having such a poor score/build might not be toxic, but  it might just be honest to god poor play. Poor play isn't something that's  bannable, but it is something that the ELO system will handle naturally (By dropping their rank). 

There are some clear cut actions such as AFKing via DC but that's already heavily punished. The other option of AFKing by remaining connected is much harder to regulate because there's nothing saying that they've done anything explicitly wrong. 

This is why the player reporting system is so necessary: It's very difficult to separate poor play and actual toxic behavior. To add to this, any automatic system that would deal with this would be very inaccurate and would only cause more problems than it would help.
While you make very good points, Riot started the automatic intentional feeder detection last patch. They intend to make it more and more punishing as they verify its accuracy.
